<BLUE><MOJI0></BLUE> is now on your shelf.

Stamina can be recovered by eating <BLUE>vegetables</BLUE>
and any of the various <BLUE>dishes</BLUE> that can be
cooked up.

Different foods will give you different amounts of
stamina, so be sure to try a wide variety.



                              1/3

To eat something, open your <BLUE>bag</BLUE> and select an
item with the <RED>A Button</RED>. Then, select "Eat."

You can also select a food or dish that you've
<BLUE>added</BLUE> to the <BLUE>Fast Access Menu</BLUE> and press the 
<RED>X Button</RED> to eat it.



                              2/3

You can also recover stamina by ordering dishes
at the <GREEN>restaurant</GREEN> or making a trip to the <GREEN>clinic</GREEN>.

But keep in mind that both of those options
require money, so make sure you have enough.




                              3/3

Just press the <RED>A Button</RED> when you're standing
over an item to pick it up and put it in your bag.

Merchants from other countries will come to
town to do business at the <GREEN>Trade Depot</GREEN>. Sales to
and purchases from these merchants is what we
call <RED>Trading</RED>.

Purchasing from the town's <GREEN>merchants</GREEN> and the
<GREEN>carpenter</GREEN> do not count as trading, since they're
local.

                              1/4

At the <GREEN>Trade Depot</GREEN>, there's a merchant at the
desk who'll assist you with your trading options.

"Shipping"
Ships your items to other countries. After
pressing the <RED>X Button</RED> on the shipping menu,
you can press the <RED>L Button</RED> or <RED>R Button</RED> to
switch slots and ship things outside of your
bag.
                              2/4

"Ship <BLUE>Wanted</BLUE> Items"
Ship items that other vendors have <BLUE>requested</BLUE>.
You can see what's in demand at the information
center.

"Purchasing Items"
Purchase items or recipes.


                              3/4

"Animals"
Buy, sell, or mate <BLUE>domesticated animals</BLUE> or <BLUE>Pets</BLUE>.







                              4/4

With <BLUE>seeds</BLUE> equipped, press the <RED>A Button</RED> while
standing on a plowed field to plant them.

If you hold down the <RED>A Button</RED> and move the
<RED>Circle Pad</RED>, you can move around while sowing
seeds.

When you have a <BLUE>hoe</BLUE> equipped, a white grid will
appear that shows where you can till the field.
Press the <RED>A Button</RED> to till that area. When the
field is ready to use, the white grid will
disappear.

Keep in mind that areas that cannot be hoed will
not display the white grid around them.

With a <BLUE>watering can</BLUE> equipped, stand in front of
a tilled field and press the <RED>A Button</RED> to water it.

If you hold down the <RED>A Button</RED> and move the
<RED>Circle Pad</RED>, you can move around while watering
your crops.



                              1/2

It may take a little while before the fields have
enough water. Watch for the color of the ground
to change to let you know when you've watered
enough.





                              2/2

When crops are ripe, stand in front of them and
press the <RED>A Button</RED> to harvest them and put
them into a basket.

Next, press the <RED>A Button</RED> in front of the basket to
add its contents to your bag.



                              1/2

Some crops, like <BLUE>rice stalks</BLUE> and <BLUE>wheat</BLUE>, require a
<BLUE>sickle</BLUE> to cut and harvest. 







                              2/2

To feed your animals, throw a clump of <BLUE>fodder</BLUE>
into the square <GREEN>feeding area</GREEN> in the barn or coop.

When there's fodder inside the feeding area,
animals will come and eat it.




                              1/2

If you leave fodder in your <BLUE>storage</BLUE>, you can take
some out from the <GREEN>slot</GREEN> inside the barn.

When you gather fodder, make sure to toss it in
the storage so it'll be ready when you want to
feed your animals.



                              2/2

With a <BLUE>brush</BLUE> equipped, stand next to an animal
and press the <RED>A Button</RED> to brush it. You can hold
down the Button to keep brushing your animals.

If you hold down the <RED>A Button</RED> and move the
<RED>Circle Pad</RED>, you can move around while
brushing.

With a <BLUE>milker</BLUE> equipped, stand next to any of
your cattle and press the <RED>A Button</RED> to use it.

If you hold down the <RED>A Button</RED> and move the
<RED>Circle Pad</RED>, you can move around while milking.




                              1/2

When you approach cattle with a milker
equipped, you'll notice a gauge appear at the
bottom-left of the upper screen.

As you milk, the gauge will fill up. Once it's full,
the gauge will turn into a milk can, which you
can collect. Keep this in mind as you're milking
your cattle.

                              2/2

With a pair of <BLUE>clippers</BLUE> equipped, stand next to
an animal and press the <RED>A Button</RED> to use them.

If you hold down the <RED>A Button</RED> and move the
<RED>Circle Pad</RED>, you can move around while shearing
wool from <BLUE>sheep</BLUE> and other furry animals.



                              1/2

When you approach an animal with a pair of
clippers equipped, you'll notice a gauge appear
at the bottom-left of the upper screen.

As you shear, the gauge will fill up. Once it's
full, the gauge will turn into wool, which you
can collect. Keep this in mind as you're shearing
your animals.

                              2/2

With a <BLUE>stethoscope</BLUE> equipped, stand next to an
animal and press the <RED>A Button</RED> to use it.

When you use it, that animal's <GREEN>notebook entry</GREEN>
will open and you can check its health.

Use the <BLUE>pitchfork</BLUE> to clean up the <BLUE>waste</BLUE> that
builds up inside barns.

With your pitchfork equipped, stand in front of a
pile of waste and press the <RED>A Button</RED> to clean it
up.

If you hold down the <RED>A Button</RED> and move the
<RED>Circle Pad</RED>, you can move around while
cleaning.

With a <BLUE>sickle</BLUE> equipped, stand next to a crop and
press the <RED>A Button</RED> to use it.

If you hold down the <RED>A Button</RED> and move the
<RED>Circle Pad</RED>, you can move around while reaping.




                              1/2

You can use the sickle to cut <BLUE>grass</BLUE>, <BLUE>rice stalks</BLUE>
and <BLUE>dried crops</BLUE> like wheat, when they are ripe.

Be careful when using the sickle, as it will
remove crops that should be harvested by hand,
are withered, or are not ripe.



                              2/2

<RED>Conquest</RED> is a competition between other
farmers run by the town's <GREEN>guild</GREEN>.

Current land owners can enter the competition
<RED>after their term for the land has expired</RED>.

Before the land is parceled out again, go to the
guild and register for the competition to make
sure you stake your claim!                             
                              1/3

You can select from <GREEN>yearly</GREEN> results or <GREEN>amount of
trade shipments</GREEN>. As the town grows, you'll be
able to compare by additional conditions.

Pick the one you're most confident in and aim
for victory!



                              2/3

After the challenge has ended, either go to the
guild or wait for the results the next day.

If you win the conquest challenge, you'll have
the opportunity to claim the rights to use that
field.



                              3/3

With a <BLUE>fishing pole</BLUE> equipped, stand at the
<GREEN>fishing spot</GREEN> on the pier near the river. Press the
<RED>A Button</RED> to fish.

When you begin fishing, you'll notice a bobber
floating on the surface. When it sinks and a "!"
appears, mash the <RED>A Button</RED> to catch the fish!

When you visit the <GREEN>safari park</GREEN>, you can see
exotic animals from other countries and mine
<BLUE>ore</BLUE>.

In order to visit the safari park, you'll either <RED>need
to register with the guild</RED> or <RED>travel there on
horseback from the stable</RED>.


                              1/2

If you decide to go to the safari park via the
guild, you can take the animals you currently
own.

When visiting the safari park, animals' stress will
go down at a faster rate than it does on the
farm. If any of your animals really stressing out,
a safari excursion may be just the thing they
need.
                              2/2

You have your very own stall at the <GREEN>Trade Depot</GREEN>!
It's the <RED>shop on the left side near the entrance</RED>.

You can examine the counter at any time to
open up shop, or collect the profit your stall has
accumulated.



                              1/4

"Open Shop"
Select which type of things you'd like to sell and
open the shop.

"Display Products"
Select the items you want to list for sale. You
can set the prince and the quantity you'd like to
offer.

                              2/4

"Remove Products"
Remove items that you've listed for display in the
shop.

"Collect Profit"
Collect the profits you've made from your stall's
sales.


                              3/4

"Close Shop"
Close up your shop. You can still close at any
time even if you haven't sold all your products.






                              4/4

You can check your newly-purchased <BLUE>blueprints</BLUE>
at the "<BLUE>Craft Table</BLUE>."

At the table, you can build objects and tools by
looking at a blueprint and selecting "Build" from
the options.

When you're on a pier and see an area that says
"<GREEN>Jump in the river (or pond)</GREEN>", press the <RED>B Button</RED>
to dive in.

Just like with walking, use the <RED>Circle Pad</RED> to
swim in any direction.



                              1/2

To stop swimming, swim to the area near the
pier that says "<GREEN>Get out of the river (or pond)</GREEN>",
and press the <RED>B Button</RED>.






                              2/2

Sometimes, shops from other countries will
post <BLUE>requests</BLUE>, such as "Please ship X _______"
posted at the <GREEN>information desk</GREEN>.

In order to complete an accepted <BLUE>request</BLUE>, go to
the shop that posted the <BLUE>request</BLUE> and select
<BLUE>"Ship requested items"</BLUE>. You'll receive a reward
for your efforts!

                              1/2

When you accept a <BLUE>request</BLUE>, you may see
<BLUE>requests</BLUE> listed in blue. These are a bit different
from the others.

<RED>You can receive recipes and blueprints as
rewards</RED> from fulfilling these requests, so it's
often a good idea to make them a high priority.


                              2/2

The layout of the <GREEN>town square</GREEN> <RED>can be freely
edited</RED>, just like your farm.

Examine the <GREEN>sign</GREEN> next to the square to freely edit
the layout and decorations.

You can place many objects, both built and
bought, around the square to show your
hometown pride!

When you <GREEN>StreetPass</GREEN> with other players, <RED>you
can have other Nintendo 3DS owners come visit
your town</RED>.

StreetPass visitors will be able to tour the
various areas of your town and see your unique
vision of Oak Tree Town.


                              1/4

In order to StreetPass, you must activate it at
the town's <GREEN>guild</GREEN>.

Once you've activated StreetPass, you must
<RED>write in your journal to begin</RED>. Also, make sure
your Nintendo 3DS's <RED>wireless functionality</RED> has
been activated.


                              2/4

<RED>When you StreetPass with another player, your
character and animals' names can be seen by
visitors</RED>. If you don't want others to see that info,
please don't set up StreetPass.

Once you begin using StreetPass, each time you
write in your journal, the information you send
out will be updated with your most recent
progress.
                              3/4

If you have two separate journals written,
StreetPass visitors will come to both places, so
you needn't worry about missing out on the
tourism!





                              4/4

You can get involved in <RED>Farm Tours</RED> by hosting
visitors on your farm, or going to visit other
people's farms via an online connection.

You can start a Farm Tour from the <GREEN>title screen</GREEN>.
If you would like to connect, just write in your
journal to record your most recent progress,
then go back to the title screen.

                              1/4

When you go to other people's farms, you'll take
one item with you as a gift.

When people come to visit your farm, you'll need
to prepare three items as gifts.

You can receive your gifts at the guild after
closing the connection.

                              2/4

While touring farms, you can equip the <BLUE>magic
wand</BLUE> and wave it with the <RED>A Button</RED>. When you
wave it at a crop, that crop will <GREEN>go up in quality</GREEN>,
and when you wave it at an animal, it'll <GREEN>decrease
that animal's stress</GREEN>.

Players can also communicate with one another
via the Emotive Chat system.

                              3/4

Just like with StreetPass, after you tour a farm,
other people will come to your town. <RED>If you've
disabled StreetPass, though, you won't get any
visitors to your town</RED>.

Farm tours are a great way to meet and interact
with your fellow farmers!


                              4/4

There are six important things to know about
when taking care of <BLUE>cows</BLUE>: <GREEN>Milking</GREEN>, <GREEN>Brushing</GREEN>,
<GREEN>Petting</GREEN>, <GREEN>Feeding</GREEN>, <GREEN>Grazing</GREEN>, and <GREEN>Treats</GREEN>.






                              1/5

"Milking"
Equip a <BLUE>milker</BLUE> to collect <BLUE>milk</BLUE> from your cows.

"Brushing"
Equip a <BLUE>brush</BLUE> to clean and groom your cows.




                              2/5

"Petting"
If you press the <RED>A Button</RED> when you have
nothing equipped, you can pet your cows.

"Feeding"
Toss the <BLUE>fodder</BLUE> into the barn's <GREEN>feeding area</GREEN> to
feed your cows.


                              3/5

"Grazing"
If you push your cows, you can move them into
or out of the barn.

If you take your cows outside on sunny days,
their stress level will decrease. Grazing cows is
essential to their well-being.


                              4/5

"Treats"
Equip a <BLUE>treat</BLUE> and press the <RED>A Button</RED> to feed it to
a cow.

You can only give one treat per animal, per day,
and you can check the amount given in your
animal notebook. If you give your animals lots of
treats, good things may happen.

                              5/5

There are six important things to know about
when taking care of <BLUE>sheep</BLUE>: <GREEN>Shearing</GREEN>, <GREEN>Brushing</GREEN>,
<GREEN>Petting</GREEN>, <GREEN>Feeding</GREEN>, <GREEN>Grazing</GREEN>, and <GREEN>Treats</GREEN>.






                              1/5

"Shearing"
When a sheep has grown a thick, wooly coat,
equip a pair of <BLUE>clippers</BLUE> to shear its <BLUE>wool</BLUE>.

"Brushing"
Equip a <BLUE>brush</BLUE> to clean and groom your sheep.



                              2/5

"Petting"
If you press the <RED>A Button</RED> when you have
nothing equipped, you can pet your sheep.

"Feeding"
Toss the <BLUE>fodder</BLUE> into the barn's <GREEN>feeding area</GREEN> to
feed your sheep.


                              3/5

"Grazing"
If you push your sheep, you can move them into
or out of the barn.

If you take your sheep outside on sunny days,
their stress level will decrease. Grazing sheep is
essential to their well-being.


                              4/5

"Treats"
Equip a <BLUE>treat</BLUE> and press the <RED>A Button</RED> to feed it to
a sheep.

You can only give one treat per animal, per day,
and you can check the amount given in your
animal notebook. If you give your animals lots of
treats, good things may happen.

                              5/5

There are five important things to know about
taking care of <BLUE>chickens</BLUE>: <GREEN>Collecting Eggs</GREEN>,
<GREEN>Petting</GREEN>, <GREEN>Feeding</GREEN>, <GREEN>Grazing</GREEN>, and <GREEN>Treats</GREEN>.






                              1/5

"Collecting Eggs"
You can pick up and collect chickens' eggs.

"Petting"
If you press the <RED>A Button</RED> when you have
nothing equipped, you can pet your chickens.



                              2/5

"Feeding"
Toss the <BLUE>chicken feed</BLUE> into the coop's <GREEN>feeding
area</GREEN> to feed your chickens. You can purchase
<BLUE>chicken feed</BLUE> at the town <GREEN>General Store</GREEN>.





                              3/5

"Grazing"
If you pick up your chickens, you can take them
outside or move them back into the coop.

If you take your chickens outside on sunny days,
their stress level will decrease. Letting chickens
roam about is essential to their well being.


                              4/5

"Treats"
Equip a <BLUE>treat</BLUE> and press the <RED>A Button</RED> to feed it to
a chicken.

You can only give one treat per animal, per day,
and you can check the amount given in your
animal notebook. If you give your animals lots of
treats, good things may happen.

                              5/5

There are six important things to know about
when taking care of <BLUE>alpacas</BLUE>: <GREEN>Shearing</GREEN>,
<GREEN>Brushing</GREEN>, <GREEN>Petting</GREEN>, <GREEN>Feeding</GREEN>, <GREEN>Grazing</GREEN>, and <GREEN>Treats</GREEN>.






                              1/5

"Shearing"
When an alpaca has grown a thick, wooly coat,
equip a pair of <BLUE>clippers</BLUE> to shear its <BLUE>wool</BLUE>.

"Brushing"
Equip a <BLUE>brush</BLUE> to clean and groom your alpacas.



                              2/5

"Petting"
If you press the <RED>A Button</RED> when you have
nothing equipped, you can pet your alpacas.

"Feeding"
Toss the <BLUE>fodder</BLUE> into the barn's <GREEN>feeding area</GREEN> to
feed your alpacas.


                              3/5

"Grazing"
If you push your alpacas, you can move them
into or out of the barn.

If you take your alpacas outside on sunny days,
their stress level will decrease. Grazing alpacas
is essential to their well-being.


                              4/5

"Treats"
Equip a <BLUE>treat</BLUE> and press the <RED>A Button</RED> to feed it to
an alpaca.

You can only give one treat per animal, per day,
and you can check the amount given in your
animal notebook. If you give your animals lots of
treats, good things may happen.

                              5/5

"Feeding"

                              3/5

If you take your llamas outside on sunny days,

                              4/5

"Treats"

a llama.

You can only give one treat per animal, per day,
and you can check the amount given in your
animal notebook. If you give your animals lots of
treats, good things may happen.

                              5/5

There are six important things to know about
when taking care of <BLUE>Angora goats</BLUE>: <GREEN>Shearing</GREEN>,
<GREEN>Brushing</GREEN>, <GREEN>Petting</GREEN>, <GREEN>Feeding</GREEN>, <GREEN>Grazing</GREEN> and <GREEN>Treats</GREEN>.






                              1/5

"Shearing"
When an Angora goat has grown a thick, wooly
coat, equip a pair of <BLUE>clippers</BLUE> to shear its <BLUE>wool</BLUE>.

"Brushing"
Equip a <BLUE>brush</BLUE> to clean and groom your Angora
goats.


                              2/5

"Petting"
If you press the <RED>A Button</RED> when you have
nothing equipped, you can pet your Angora
goats.

"Feeding"
Toss the <BLUE>fodder</BLUE> into the barn's <GREEN>feeding area</GREEN> to
feed your Angora goats.

                              3/5

"Grazing"
If you push your Angora goats, you can move
them into or out of the barn.

If you take your goats outside on sunny days,
their stress level will decrease. Grazing goats is
essential to their well-being.


                              4/5

"Treats"
Equip a <BLUE>treat</BLUE> and press the <RED>A Button</RED> to feed it to
an Angora goat.

You can only give one treat per animal, per day,
and you can check the amount given in your
animal notebook. If you give your animals lots of
treats, good things may happen.

                              5/5

There are six important things to know about
when taking care of <BLUE>Angora rabbits</BLUE>: <GREEN>Collecting
Fur</GREEN>, <GREEN>Brushing</GREEN>, <GREEN>Petting</GREEN>, <GREEN>Feeding</GREEN>, <GREEN>Grazing</GREEN> and
<GREEN>Treats</GREEN>.





                              1/5

"Collecting Fur"
Sometimes, Angora rabbits will shed their <BLUE>rabbit
fur</BLUE>, which you can pick up.

"Brushing"
Equip a <BLUE>brush</BLUE> to clean and groom your Angora
rabbits.


                              2/5

"Petting"
If you press the <RED>A Button</RED> when you have
nothing equipped, you can pet your Angora
rabbits.

"Feeding"
Toss the <BLUE>rabbit food</BLUE> into the coop's <GREEN>feeding area</GREEN>
to feed your Angora rabbits. You can purchase
<BLUE>rabbit food</BLUE> at the town <GREEN>General Store</GREEN>.
                              3/5

"Grazing"
If you pick up your Angora rabbits, you can take
them outside or move them back into the coop.

If you take your rabbits outside on sunny days,
their stress level will decrease. Letting rabbits
roam about is essential to their well being.


                              4/5

"Treats"
Equip a <BLUE>treat</BLUE> and press the <RED>A Button</RED> to feed it to
an Angora rabbit.

You can only give one treat per animal, per day,
and you can check the amount given in your
animal notebook. If you give your animals lots of
treats, good things may happen.

                              5/5

when taking care of <BLUE>zebus</BLUE>: <GREEN>Milking</GREEN>, <GREEN>Brushing</GREEN>,

                              1/5

"Brushing"

or out of the barn.

                              4/5

You can only give one treat per animal, per day,

                              5/5

There are six important things to know about
when taking care of <BLUE>camels</BLUE>: <GREEN>Shearing</GREEN>, <GREEN>Brushing</GREEN>,
<GREEN>Petting</GREEN>, <GREEN>Feeding</GREEN>, <GREEN>Grazing</GREEN> and <GREEN>Treats</GREEN>.






                              1/5

"Shearing"
When a camel has grown a thick, wooly coat,
equip a pair of <BLUE>clippers</BLUE> to shear its <BLUE>hair</BLUE>.

"Brushing"
Equip a <BLUE>brush</BLUE> to clean and groom your camels.



                              2/5

"Petting"
If you press the <RED>A Button</RED> when you have
nothing equipped, you can pet your camels.

"Feeding"
Toss the <BLUE>fodder</BLUE> into the barn's <GREEN>feeding area</GREEN> to
feed your camels.


                              3/5

"Grazing"
If you push your camels, you can move them
into or out of the barn.

If you take your camels outside on sunny days,
their stress level will decrease. Grazing camels is
essential to their well-being.


                              4/5

"Treats"
Equip a <BLUE>treat</BLUE> and press the <RED>A Button</RED> to feed it to
a camel.

You can only give one treat per animal, per day,
and you can check the amount given in your
animal notebook. If you give your animals lots of
treats, good things may happen.

                              5/5

Domesticated dogs can live in a <GREEN>pet house</GREEN>.

You can use the <GREEN>animal notebook</GREEN> to teach <BLUE>dogs</BLUE>
to help herd <RED>cows</RED> and <RED>chickens</RED>.

With enough training, dogs can even learn how
to do it on their own.


                              1/4

Initially, they'll have no training and won't be able
to help you. You can use an <BLUE>animal whistle</BLUE> to
train them to assist you. Equip the <BLUE>whistle</BLUE> and
use it on the dog.

You can see in your animal notebook if your dog
is currently helping herd animals, or just hanging
out.

                              2/4

When you raise your dog's affection toward you,
it will be able to herd more animals at once.
Keep strengthening your bond so you can
become an even more efficient, effective team!





                              3/4

You can use a <BLUE>leash</BLUE> to take your dog on a walk.
Walking helps lower dogs' stress level and helps
them maintain a healthy weight so they don't
become obese.

You can also play with your dog by using a
rubber <BLUE>dog bone</BLUE>.


                              4/4

Domesticated cats can live in a <GREEN>pet house</GREEN>.

You can use the <GREEN>animal notebook</GREEN> to teach <BLUE>cats</BLUE>
to <RED>collect items</RED> for you.

If you set them to help, cats will pick up items
for you, depending on the amount of affection
they feel toward you.

                              1/3

When you raise your cat's affection toward you,
it will be able to pick up more items. Keep
strengthening your bond to help your cat find
lots of great things!





                              2/3

You can use a <BLUE>leash</BLUE> to take your cat on a walk.
Walking helps lower cats' stress level and helps
them maintain a healthy weight so they don't
become obese.

You can also play with your cat by using a <BLUE>bell</BLUE>.



                              3/3

Domesticated horses can live in a <GREEN>barn</GREEN>. You can
ride them to travel around quickly. Even if there
are no horses in the area, you can call for one at
a <GREEN>stable</GREEN>.

If you have a <BLUE>carrot</BLUE> equipped, <RED>you can instantly
travel</RED> to the <GREEN>town</GREEN> or the <GREEN>Trade Depot</GREEN> - perfect
for busy farmers who are always on the move.

<GREEN>Barns</GREEN> are buildings that can house <BLUE>cows</BLUE> and
<BLUE>sheep</BLUE>. <BLUE>Chickens</BLUE> and <BLUE>Angora rabbits</BLUE> live in a
<GREEN>coop</GREEN> instead.

If you examine the sign on the side of the barn,
you can personalize its name to whatever you'd
like.


                              1/4

Inside barns, you'll find the <GREEN>Feeding Area</GREEN>, <GREEN>Animal
Notebook</GREEN>, <GREEN>Maternity Area</GREEN>, <GREEN>Fodder Bin</GREEN>, and <GREEN>Treat
Dispenser</GREEN>.

"Feeding Area"
You feed your animals by placing their food in
this area. They'll come to eat it when they're
hungry.

                              2/4

"Animal Notebook"
You can keep track of your animals' health,
stress, friendliness, and more in this handy
notebook.

"Maternity Area"
A space in your barn where you can prepare for
expecting animals to give birth and tend to their
young.
                              3/4

"Fodder Bin" & "Treat Dispenser"
If you have <BLUE>pet food</BLUE> or <BLUE>treats</BLUE> in your <BLUE>storage</BLUE>,
you can take them out via the bin and dispenser.






                              4/4

With the <RED>Edit</RED> function, you can place objects on
your farm or in your home to customize them
just the way you'd like. You can start editing at
the <BLUE>craft table</BLUE>.





                              1/5

Time stops while you're editing, so take all the
time you need to arrange your furniture and
decorations. Just keep in mind, <RED>you won't be
able to do anything other than editing while in
edit mode</RED>.




                              2/5

<RED>A Button</RED>: Place/Lift object
<RED>Y Button</RED>: Put object into stock
<RED>X Button</RED>: Switch to stock screen
<RED>L Button</RED>: Turn lifted object to the left
<RED>R Button</RED>: Turn lifted object to the right

Once an object is placed, you can push it to
move it around, but if there's something in the
way, you won't be able to move it.
                              3/5

Remember that if barns or coops have animals
inside them, you can't put them back into your
stock.

You can end edit mode by pressing the <RED>Y Button</RED>
when you have nothing equipped.



                              4/5

When you place an object, <RED>you can build a
combo</RED>, depending on your coordination.

Combos can give an increase in obtainable
items, item quality, and much more. Mix and
match lots of different objects and decorations
to see how many combos you can discover!


                              5/5

<RED>Rates</RED> have a direct impact on the price you can
get for shipping items. Items with high rates can
be sold for a much higher price than normal.






                              1/3

Rates also change depending on the country and
season.

Rates can be checked at "<GREEN>Recommended
Shipping</GREEN>", so look for items with high rates and
try to sell those.



                              2/3

Items in the same category, or shipping/
purchasing a certain amount to or from the
same country, will affect a category's rate. The
more you ship, the lower the rate drops, but the
more you purchase, the higher the rate rises.

Rate changes will return back to normal after a
certain amount of time has passed, so make
sure to plan your trades accordingly.
                              3/3

During sales, the shops of trading partner
countries will <RED>sell products cheaper than usual</RED>.
Making several trades with that country will
improve your relationship, which will in turn lead
to a higher chance for sales.

<BLUE>Fruit trees</BLUE> are a unique type of crop that can be
planted and raised in fields. Plant them as a
sprout, raise them up, and they'll bear fruit.
Trees grow no matter the season, but only bear
fruit in certain seasons, so keep that in mind
when planting.

To harvest fruit from fruit trees, stand next to a
tree and press the <RED>B Button</RED> to jump and the 
<RED>A Button</RED> to pick the fruit.

Harvested crops will be <RED>fresh</RED> for 3 days.

Fresh crops have perks such as selling for a
higher price and higher quality when used in
cooking.

<GREEN>Workshops</GREEN> are where you can make refined
products from raw materials. There are several
different types of workshop, and you'll likely
make good use of many of them.





                              1/4

"Sewing Studio"
You can spin <BLUE>wool</BLUE> and other fibrous materials
into <BLUE>yarn</BLUE>, <BLUE>blankets</BLUE> and <BLUE>clothing</BLUE>. You can also
make <BLUE>accessories</BLUE>.

"Pottery Studio"
You can turn <BLUE>dirt</BLUE> into <BLUE>plates</BLUE> and <BLUE>pots</BLUE>.


                              2/4

"Winery"
You can squeeze the <BLUE>juice</BLUE> from <BLUE>fruit</BLUE> and ferment
it to make your own artisanal <BLUE>wines</BLUE>.

"Seed Maker"
You dry out <BLUE>crops</BLUE> here and extract their <BLUE>seeds</BLUE> to
plant in your fields.


                              3/4

"Spice Factory"
You can make a variety of <BLUE>herbs</BLUE> and <BLUE>spices</BLUE> from
your <BLUE>crops</BLUE>.

"Cheese Factory"
You can turn <BLUE>milk</BLUE> into <BLUE>cheese</BLUE>, <BLUE>butter</BLUE>, and other
dairy products here.


                              4/4

When you use <BLUE>wrapping</BLUE>, <RED>you can put items into
boxes tied with ribbons</RED>.

When you give a wrapped item as a present,
you'll make the recipient feel happy and
appreciated.

You'll need <BLUE>ribbons</BLUE> in order to wrap, so use <BLUE>linen</BLUE>
and <BLUE>cotton<BLUE> to make <BLUE>ribbons</BLUE> first.

When you have the recipe and the required
ingredients, you can go to the <GREEN>kitchen</GREEN> to <RED>cook</RED>.

Cooking can help recover stamina and health,
and you can also give the things you cook to
friends and neighbors.

The quality and level of the resulting dish
depends on the ingredients used.
                              1/2

When you've made a certain amount of a
specific dish, you can begin to add <RED>secret
ingredients</RED> to that dish.

If you can add the perfect secret ingredient, your
dish's quality will increase even more, so keep
striving for the perfect combination of flavors!


                              2/2

You can change your <BLUE>hairstyle</BLUE>, <BLUE>face</BLUE> and <BLUE>outfits</BLUE>
in your <GREEN>closet</GREEN>.

If you want to change your <BLUE>clothing</BLUE> and
<BLUE>accessories</BLUE>, put those items in the closet to add
them to your wardrobe.

When you use the balloon, you'll immediately
float away to a random area in <GREEN>Oak Tree Town</GREEN>.

It cuts down your travel time if you were headed
to town anyway, so make good use of it.

You can drive a <BLUE>custom three-wheeler</BLUE> and
several vehicles in the shape of <BLUE>animals</BLUE>.

Vehicles are stored in the <GREEN>garage</GREEN>, so when you
want to drive one, it'll be there waiting for you.

In order to ride the <BLUE>mechanical panda, duck or
penguin</BLUE>, you'll need <BLUE>coins</BLUE>. When you examine
the vehicle with a coin equipped, you can insert
the coin to drive it.

When you equip the heli-pack, you'll hover above
the ground and zip around.

In order to take off the heli-pack, just press the <RED>Y
Button</RED>.

<GREEN>Greenhouses</GREEN> are built to raise crops outside of
the seasons in which they naturally grow.

You can have the inside of your greenhouse
mimic <BLUE>spring</BLUE>, <BLUE>summer</BLUE>, <BLUE>autumn</BLUE>, and <BLUE>winter</BLUE>
conditions, allowing you to grow your favorite
crops no matter the season.

When you turn on your <BLUE>television</BLUE> you'll find a
<RED>variety of programs you can watch</RED>.

Weather forecasts are always being broadcast,
so keep up to date on the weather so you can
take advantage of it on the farm.

At the <GREEN>foot of the mountain</GREEN>, you can set up <BLUE>fish
hatcheries</BLUE> at <GREEN>harvesting points</GREEN>.

Fish hatcheries keep fish inside so they can
grow without escaping. You can use them to
cultivate <BLUE>fish</BLUE> and <BLUE>pearls</BLUE>.



                              1/3

"Fish Harvesting"
You can raise fish so you can have a steady
supply without having to fish for them. If you
use <BLUE>fish food</BLUE>, the quality of your harvested fish
will increase.




                              2/3

"Pearl Harvesting"
When you raise <BLUE>pearl oysters</BLUE>, you'll be able to
harvest pearls from them after enough time has
passed.





                              3/3

If you put <BLUE>bees</BLUE> in a <BLUE>hive box</BLUE>, they'll begin to
produce <BLUE>honey</BLUE>, which you can eventually
collect. Examine the hive box while holding a
<BLUE>bee</BLUE> to put it in the box.

The kind of <BLUE>honey</BLUE> you can collect depends on
the type of <BLUE>bees</BLUE> you have. If you scent the hive
with perfume, the bees will make better honey.

                              1/2

You can put in up to three of the same kind of
<BLUE>bees</BLUE> in a single hive box, which will increase the
amount of honey you can collect. If you put in a
different kind of <BLUE>bee</BLUE>, you'll have to build up your
honey from scratch.

You cannot harvest honey in the winter, since
the bees leave the hive box for the season. They
return in spring.
                              2/2

You can spread <BLUE>shiitake</BLUE> and <BLUE>shimeji</BLUE> mushroom
seeds on a <GREEN>mushroom log</GREEN>. After enough time
has passed, you'll then be able to harvest fresh
mushrooms.

You don't need to water mushrooms, and if you
use <BLUE>fertilizer</BLUE> while they're growing, they'll grow
to a higher quality. When you use a sickle to
harvest the mushrooms, the log will return to
normal.

When you use a <BLUE>hammer</BLUE> at a <GREEN>mining spot</GREEN> in the
<GREEN>safari park</GREEN>, you'll obtain chunks of metal ore.

You can catch <BLUE>insects</BLUE> on the roads and in the
fields. You'll come across different insects
depending on the season, time and location, so
see how many you can find. If you catch <BLUE>bees</BLUE>,
you can put them to work making honey.

These animals are not domesticated or pets.
They can be found on the roads, in the fields,
and in the safari park. <RED>If you give them some
food, they'll be a bit more friendly toward you<RED>.

When you become friendly with a certain animal
or country, new animals will appear.

You'll receive letters and notices in your <GREEN>mailbox</GREEN>.

Stores will sometimes update their wares
without notice, so check back from time to time
and you might find some useful info.

When you press the <RED>X Button</RED> or touch the bag
icon on the lower screen, you can check the
contents of your bag.

If you select an item, you'll have several options,
including "<GREEN>Pick Up</GREEN>", "<GREEN>Eat</GREEN>", and "<GREEN>Equip</GREEN>."



                              1/3

* Setting Fast Access Items

You can bring up the <BLUE>Fast Access Menu</BLUE> to equip
tools or seeds without having to open your bag.

You can add items to this menu by going into
your bag, pressing the <RED>X Button</RED>, and selecting
<BLUE>Register</BLUE>. This will bring up the <BLUE>Fast Access
Menu</BLUE>.
                              2/3

* "Combining"

If you press the <RED>Y Button</RED> while in your bag, you
can put items of the same type that have
different qualities into a single stack.

When using this option, be aware that the
quality of all items in the stack will be set to
average.
                              3/3

When you <RED>touch the book icon</RED>, you'll open the
<GREEN>save/load screen</GREEN>.

Save your game by selecting "Write in Journal"
Load your game by selecting "Read from
Journal".

<RED>Keep in mind that selecting "Return to Title
Screen" will send you back to the title screen
without saving your progress</RED>.

With a <BLUE>hammer</BLUE> equipped, stand next to a rock
and press the <RED>A Button</RED> to smash it.

If you hold down the <RED>A Button</RED> and move the
<RED>Circle Pad</RED>, you can move around while
swinging your hammer.



                              1/3

When you want to get <BLUE>stones</BLUE> you can use in
construction, place <BLUE>rocks</BLUE> on the ground and
smash them with your <BLUE>hammer</BLUE>.

You can break the giant boulders on your farm
by <RED>continuously hitting them with your hammer</RED>.



                              2/3

You can also use your <BLUE>hammer</BLUE> on a field that
has nothing planted in it to <RED>tamp down the dirt</RED>
and return the field to nature.





 
                              3/3

With the <BLUE>axe</BLUE> equipped, stand next to a <BLUE>branch</BLUE> or
<BLUE>log</BLUE> and press the <RED>A button</RED> to chop it.

When you want to make <BLUE>lumber</BLUE> from <BLUE>branches</BLUE>,
place the branches on the ground and chop them
with the <BLUE>axe</BLUE>.

You can also cut down the large trees on your
farm by <RED>continuously chopping at them with your
axe</RED>.

You can break the giant boulders on your farm by
<RED>continuously hitting them with your hammer</RED>. 

When you break boulders, you'll obtain <BLUE>stone</BLUE> that
can be used as a building material, so make sure
to bust up those rocks.

If there's been bad weather recently, you'll
sometimes find that new boulders have sprung
up on your farm.

You can cut down the large trees on your farm by
<RED>continuously chopping at them with your axe</RED>.

After you've chopped down a tree, you can
remove the <BLUE>stump</BLUE> with your <BLUE>axe</BLUE>. When you cut
down trees, you'll obtain <BLUE>lumber</BLUE>, so make sure to
keep chopping those trees.

Within a few days of being cut down, <RED>new trees</RED>
will grow naturally in open areas on the farm.

When you <RED>talk to a resident or give that person
his or her favorite gift</RED>, your relationship with them
will grow.

Your relationship will increase even further if you
<RED>participate in holiday festivals or win contests</RED>.

When you become more intimate, good things are
bound to happen, so keep trying to strengthen
your bonds.

Your health will decrease if you don't eat anything
for an entire day or if you stay up too late.

<RED>When your health is low, your stamina decreases
at a much faster rate</RED>, so be sure to take care of
yourself.

When raising flowers, baby bamboo, and herbs,
<RED>you cannot pick them while they're still small</RED>.

They grow bigger with every passing day, though,
so just wait until they're fully grown.

Crops will <RED>dry out if you do not water them for
long periods of time</RED>. Keep in mind that if crops
dry out, you won't be able to harvest them.

Seasons can also affect the crops' growth --
<RED>when a season changes, it's possible for crops to
dry out</RED>, so keep a close eye on the changing of
the seasons.
